alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:46AM CST until February 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by steady rainfall over frozen soil expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following county, La Salle. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas including ditches, farm fields, and the shoulders of roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1045 AM CST, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated steady rain. - Up to one inch of rain has fallen so far, and an additional half inch of rain is possible by noon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ottawa, Peru, La Salle, Mendota, Marseilles, Sheridan, Lake Holiday, Oglesby, Seneca, North Utica, Serena, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Naplate, Millington, Dayton, Lostant, Cedar Point, Troy Grove and Leonore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
